A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I thoroughly enjoyed it\, I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews\, especially considering how the movie managed to get an applause from the theater I viewed it in.

Anyway\, I had a feeling that this wouldn't be a simple good vs evil narrative\, and that the "bad guy" wasn't being bad for the sake of being bad. There's a romantic energy that I've never seen in a Star Wars movie before\, it's darker and more intense. It also leads to one of the most satisfying twists I've seen in a long time\, in any movie. There's a lot of unexpected\, some expected\, and one's heart may break a few times. 

Though I must admit\, I did find a few flaws with the movie\, as much as I had enjoyed it. There were bits of comedy that seemed extremely out of place\, sort of forced (no pun intended) even. One of the narratives within the movie seemed a bit on the corny side\, one of the twists was a bit of a letdown (but a relief\, too\, in a sense). 

So\, no\, the movie isn't without faults\, but it was extremely enjoyable. It delivered a rather unexpected but intense sort of romance\, which led way to one of the most satisfying plot twists in the series. I say give it a chance before you draw conclusions from some of the tantrums thrown in the reviews.
